intro: Linaria multicaulis subsp. gigantea, commonly known as the giant stickseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant produces numerous narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
